content:
Hi, i have a very simple problem but i cant find the correct rule to apply to close my goal.
My hypothesis is
F ⊆ Q and from this i want to show that F = Q ∩ F
both F and Q are Finsets.

I hope you can help me,
thanks in advance :)
Does exact? find it? If not then you can prove it using extensionality
I guessed the name would be something like Finset. ... subset_iff ... or Finset. ... iff_subset .... Found this using the docs search: docs#Finset.inter_eq_left_iff_subset

ok thanks, using extensionality worked.
I did 

ext q
simp
tauto

to close the goal
HenrikT has marked this topic as resolved.
